title: GitLab Customer + CSM Operational Cheatsheet
subtitle: A fast, handbook-aligned review of what enterprise customers should manage and how CSMs guide the motion.
overview_points: Use this as a one-screen operating reference before cadence calls, workshops, EBRs, and renewal checkpoints.
Customer priorities focus on outcomes and adoption velocity; CSM guidance focuses on repeatable execution and risk prevention.
Targets align to AMER CSM handbook expectations: onboarding speed, engagement rhythm, value delivery, and renewal readiness.

handbook_links.label: AMER CSM Segment
handbook_links.description: Primary operating model for Align & Onboard, Enable, and Expand & Renew.

handbook_links.label: Success Plans
handbook_links.description: How to structure measurable objectives and keep plans updated quarterly.

handbook_links.label: Customer Health Scoring
handbook_links.description: PROVE health framework and signal interpretation.

handbook_links.label: CSM Playbooks
handbook_links.description: Operational playbooks for CI, CD, Secure, and risk handling.

priority_matrix.customer_cares: Get teams productive quickly and prove early value.
customer_focus: Working platform access (SSO, runners, project setup)
First production value with active users
csm_guidance: Run kickoff and document success criteria in the success plan
Track first engage (<=14d), first value (<=30d), onboarding complete (<=45d)
priority_matrix.example: Use case: New enterprise customer migrating from multiple tools. CSM sequences kickoff, onboarding checklist, and CI workshop to reach first value in the first month.

priority_matrix.customer_cares: Drive adoption in daily workflows and remove execution bottlenecks.
customer_focus: Use-case adoption growth across SCM, CI, Secure, and Release
Quarterly workshops tied to adoption gaps
csm_guidance: Maintain weekly or biweekly cadence and never exceed 30 days without a customer call
Use playbooks to move lowest-scoring use case to green
Deliver at least one workshop per quarter per account
priority_matrix.example: Use case: CI adoption stalled at 35% project coverage. CSM runs CI/Verify workshop, tracks template rollout, and confirms increased pipeline coverage in 30 days.

priority_matrix.customer_cares: Demonstrate business outcomes and de-risk renewal while identifying growth paths.
customer_focus: EBR story grounded in measurable outcomes
Renewal readiness across stakeholders, outcomes, and commercial alignment
Expansion plays with clear owners and win rate tracking
csm_guidance: Run at least one EBR every 12 months and maintain forward roadmap
Keep success plan updated quarterly with customer + manager validation
Elevate renewal risk when readiness gaps remain inside 90 days
priority_matrix.example: Use case: Renewal in 75 days with mixed sentiment. CSM prioritizes outcomes validation, executive alignment, and risk plan closure before commercial finalization.

operating_rhythm.name: Cadence calls
operating_rhythm.target: Weekly or biweekly; never more than 30 days between calls
operating_rhythm.csm_motion: Track attendance, agenda outcomes, and next commitments each session
operating_rhythm.if_missed: At 30+ days trigger non-engaged triage; at 45+ days run recovery plan

operating_rhythm.name: Workshops
operating_rhythm.target: At least 1 workshop per quarter per customer
operating_rhythm.customer_need: Practical enablement against real adoption gaps
operating_rhythm.csm_motion: Tie workshop theme to lowest-scoring use case and target metric lift
operating_rhythm.if_missed: Mark enablement gap and schedule before quarter end

operating_rhythm.name: EBR cadence
operating_rhythm.customer_need: Executive alignment on outcomes and roadmap
operating_rhythm.csm_motion: Use 60/30/14/7 prep timeline and outcome narrative
operating_rhythm.if_missed: Flag governance gap and schedule next EBR target immediately

operating_rhythm.name: Success plan governance
operating_rhythm.target: Updated quarterly and validated by customer + manager
operating_rhythm.customer_need: Shared, current plan tied to measurable value
operating_rhythm.csm_motion: Review objective progress, evidence, blockers, and owner accountability
operating_rhythm.if_missed: Mark plan stale, update in quarter, and recover validations

operating_rhythm.name: Health + escalation updates
operating_rhythm.target: Green monthly, Yellow biweekly, Red weekly; escalation severity overrides
operating_rhythm.customer_need: Predictable risk management and rapid response
operating_rhythm.csm_motion: Publish updates on schedule and adjust cadence for P1/P2/P3 escalations
operating_rhythm.if_missed: Treat as operating risk and prioritize overdue update

lifecycle_flow.goal: Align outcomes, owners, and baseline metrics
lifecycle_flow.exit_criteria: Success criteria and governance cadence approved

lifecycle_flow.goal: Deploy and enable platform for initial teams
lifecycle_flow.exit_criteria: Onboarding tasks complete and first users active

lifecycle_flow.goal: Increase use-case depth across SCM, CI, Secure, and Release
lifecycle_flow.exit_criteria: Priority use cases trend toward green thresholds

lifecycle_flow.goal: Operationalize workshops, EBRs, and value storytelling
lifecycle_flow.exit_criteria: Quarterly motions run on cadence with measurable impact

lifecycle_flow.goal: De-risk renewal and open expansion plays
lifecycle_flow.exit_criteria: Readiness complete and growth plan owners active

use_cases.name: SCM consolidation
use_cases.scenario: Teams are split across Git providers and code review tools.
use_cases.customer_goal: One source of truth for repositories and merge request workflows.
use_cases.recommended_motion: Sequence migration waves, standardize merge request workflow, and coach team leads.
metrics: Merge request adoption and review coverage
use_cases.example: A global manufacturer moved remaining legacy repositories and increased merge request coverage above internal quality targets.

use_cases.name: CI standardization
use_cases.scenario: Pipeline coverage is inconsistent and runner utilization is unstable.
use_cases.customer_goal: Reliable CI at scale with higher pipeline success.
use_cases.recommended_motion: Run CI/Verify workshop, ship reusable templates, and track adoption by priority projects.
use_cases.example: A financial services platform raised CI-enabled project coverage after a template rollout and runner capacity plan.

use_cases.name: Secure baseline rollout
use_cases.scenario: Regulated applications are missing security scan coverage.
use_cases.customer_goal: Integrate SAST and dependency scanning into delivery workflow.
use_cases.recommended_motion: Hold Secure workshop, align policy owners, and phase rollout by critical app tier.
use_cases.example: A healthcare software team used policy alignment plus a secure workshop to expand scan coverage for regulated repos.

use_cases.name: Renewal readiness execution
use_cases.scenario: Renewal is approaching and sentiment is flat to down.
use_cases.customer_goal: Renew based on validated outcomes and aligned stakeholders.
use_cases.recommended_motion: Run EBR prep timeline, close readiness checklist gaps, and tie success plan evidence to commercial conversation.
metrics: Days to renewal and readiness completion
Success plan objective evidence and validations
use_cases.example: An enterprise retail account reduced renewal risk by closing outcomes validation and executive alignment gaps before commercial review.

anti_patterns.risk: Cadence drifts beyond one month without contact
anti_patterns.better_motion: Trigger non-engaged triage and execute a recovery checklist with clear owners
Update objective evidence, review blockers, and capture customer + manager validations

anti_patterns.risk: EBR scheduled too late to influence renewal
anti_patterns.better_motion: Use 60/30/14/7 prep timeline and lock attendee/outcome commitments early
